bibl.title: William Reitman v. Henry M. White. Court Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Filed in the United States District Court Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of William Reitman, for a writ of habeas corpus

On reading and filing the complaint of William Reitan, and it appearing therefrom that said William Reitman is unlawfully restrained of his liberty at the United States Detention Station in Seattle, King County, Washington, by Henry M. White, Commissioner of Labor of the United States, acting under the pretended authority of a warrant of arrest issued by the Secretary of Labor of the United States, wherein it is charged that said complainant is an alien, and that he has been found advocating and teaching the unlawful destruction of property; and that he was a person likely to become a public charge at the time of his entry into the United States, and that a hearing was held to inquire into the merits of said charges, and that a complete copy of the testimony taken at said hearing is in the possession of said Henry M. White, and ought to be produced on the hearing of the above entitled matter, in order that the court may have the best evidence available upon the issues tendered in the complaint herein.

NOW THEREFORE IT IS ORDERED, that Henry M.White,Commissioner of Labor of the United States, stationed at Seattle,Washington, before me on the 9th day of December,1918, at 2 o'clock in the afternoon, then and there show cause, if any he has,why the said William Reitman . should be further restrained of his liberty, and why a writ of habeas corpus should not issue herein as in the complaint.
Done in open court this 5th day of Dec 1918.
